meanings.definition: In the direction of the sun.
meanings.sent1: The flowers turned sunwards to soak up the warmth.
meanings.sent2: She walked sunwards, feeling the sun on her face.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched lazily, arching its back sunwards.
meanings.sent4: The sunflower stood tall, reaching sunwards as if in a dance.
meanings.sent5: The children ran sunwards, chasing their shadows in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The bird flew sunwards, following the path of the sun.
meanings.sent2: The leaves on the tree leaned sunwards, basking in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its tail happily, gazing sunwards.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed gently, meandering sunwards through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The hiker climbed sunwards, seeking the warmth of the sun on the mountain.
